result.execSummary:
The defendant Govanni E Martinez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
In amounts of:  $354.25 to McDonald's, $536.00 to Subway located at 3025 S. 60th  Street, Milwaukee, WI; and $498.00 to Subway located at 3179 S. 27 Street, Milwaukee, WI.    These amounts joint and several with Matthew Stehr 15CF471.
And $238.00 to be paid to NAPA Auto Parts.

Pay DNA surcharge as to count one.  No DNA  surcharge ordered on counts 2, 3, and 4 as it has been orderd on count one.
AS TO ALL COUNTS:  Pay all costs, surcharges and restitution.  To be paid from up to 25% of prison funds and wages.  Any balance as a condition of Extended Supervision.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for 243 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.  Obtain high school diploma or GED.
Mental health assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
No contact with the victims:  Burger King located at 4555 W. Forest Home Ave, Greenfield, WI; Mcdonald at 830 E. Pottere Ave, Milwaukee, WI.; Subway located at 3025 S. 60 Street, Milwaukee, WI.; Burger King at 4651 S. 27 Street, Milwaukee, WI.; Subway at 3179 S. 27 Street, Milwaukee, WI.; NAPA Auto Parts at 3649 S. Point Terrace, Milwaukee, WI.; and the coactor Matthew Stehr.
Alcohol and drug assessment.  Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

supervisions.notes: AS TO ALL COUNTS:  Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by DOC, but to include: those as listed.

Submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.  Civil rights suspended until reinstated.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
---Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program afer serving seven (7) years Initial Confinement in this case.

records.addlTxt:
Filed, signed Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order.  
It is ordered that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release date.
It is further ordered that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release upon receipt of this order.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 2, Judge Childs.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Govanni E Martinez in court with attorney Paul Garland Bonneson.  Defendant Govanni E Martinez in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  Additional statement by Dayana H.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 39 months, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 2 years with credit for 243 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 15 months.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done and pay the mandatory DNA surcharge. To be paid out of up to 25% prison funds and wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

AS TO COUNTS 2, 3, 4:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 39 months, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 2 years with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 15 months.

The Court ordered no DNA sample or DNA surcharge on counts 2, 3, and 4, as it has been ordered on count 1.

AS TO ALL COUNTS:
Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:
 
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victims:  Burger King located at 4555 W. Forest Home Ave, Greenfield, WI., McDonalds located at 830 E. Potter Ave, MIlwaukee, WI., Subway located at 3025 S. 60th St., Milwaukee, WI., Burger King located at 4651 S. 27th St., Milwaukee, WI., Subway located at 3179 S. 27th St., Milwaukee, WI., NAPA Auto Parts located at 3649 South Point Terrace, Milwakee, WI. and the Co-actor: Matthew Stehr.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is ordered in the amounts of $354.25 to be paid to McDonald's, joint and several with Matthew Stehr 15CF471, $536.00 to be paid to Subway located at 3025 S. 60th St., Milwaukee, WI., joint and several with Matthew Stehr 15CF471, $498.00 to be paid to Subway located at 3179 S. 27th St., Milwaukee, WI., joint and several with Matthew Stehr 15CF471, $238.00 to be paid to NAPA Auto Parts.  

- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs, surcharges and restitution, out of up to 25% prison funds and wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 7 years initial confinement in this case.

Appeal rights given.  
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Govanni E Martinez in court with attorney Paul Garland Bonneson.  Defendant Govanni E Martinez in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Case passed;
Case recalled:
Same appearances:

AS TO ALL COUNTS 1-4:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms/body armour warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.   Defendant REMANDED pending sentencing.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Letter from attorney Paul Bonneson withdrawing his motion to suppress that was filed on August 17, 2015, received and filed.

Motion hearing scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
